data.title: CLI to develop first data center in Japan with $944m investment
data.description:
The data center project will have a power capacity of 50 megawatts (MW).

CapitaLand Investment (CLI) will develop its first data center in Japan at the newly acquired freehold land parcel in Osaka.

CLI will invest over $944.3m for the data center project with a power capacity of 50 megawatts (MW).

The Osaka data center will be equipped with artificial intelligence (AI). It will be designed, built, and certified in accordance with Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) or an equivalent Japanese green-certification standard.

The facility will integrate energy-saving solutions such as advanced cooling technologies and adopt industry best practices in temperature management to enhance energy and water usage efficiency.

In addition, the data center will utilise products with zero ozone depletion potential or with a global warming potential (GWP) of less than 100 to minimise environmental impact.

“Major cloud service providers such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Oracle already have a presence in Osaka. Our acquisition is well-positioned to capture demand in Osaka’s established data center cluster,” Manohar Khiatani, senior executive director of CLI said.

data.title: Keppel DC REIT issues 40.67 million sponsor subscription units at $2.090 each
data.description:
The issuance is part of its equity fundraising initiative.

Keppel DC REIT has issued 40,670,000 sponsor subscription units at an issue price of $2.090 per unit.

This move is part of its equity fundraising initiative to raise approximately $1.1b in gross proceeds.

With this issuance, the total number of units in circulation stands at 2,249,745,362 as of 3 February.

The newly issued units will begin trading on the Mainboard of Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited (SGX-ST) on 4 February at 9:00 a.m.

data.title: SingPost CEO resigns
data.description:
The group COO will assume more responsibility for the group.

Singapore Post CEO Shahrin Abdol Salam has resigned and is leaving to ‘pursue opportunities outside the Company’, according to a bourse filing.

Salam was appointed CEO in May 2024.

A transition timeline is being worked out with Neo Su Yin, Group COO, who will assume additional responsibility as CEO of Singapore following his departure. Su Yin previously held the CEO position in SingPost in November 2021 to May 2024 before she moved to dnata as managing director for Singapore.

Salam's resignation follows the dismissal of three executives in December over mishandling whistleblower complaints.

data.title: Singapore auction listings rise, but sales lag in Q4 2024
data.description:
Auction sale listings surged by47.7% QoQ to 127 in Q4 2024.

The Singapore auction market saw a notable increase in listings in Q4 2024, but a persistent gap in price expectations between buyers and sellers remains, Knight Frank said.

In its commentary, the real estate consultant noted that while more properties were put up for auction, many transactions were concluded through private treaty after the event rather than during the auction itself.

Auction sale listings surged by 47.7% QoQ to 127 in Q4 2024. For the entire year, 418 properties were listed, reflecting a 16.8% YoY increase. The rise was largely driven by mortgage sale listings, which climbed by 61.3% YoY to 171.

Despite this growth in listings, gross sales value dropped by 17.5% YoY to S$28.7m, with only 15 properties sold in 2024, down from 24 in 2023. As a result, the overall success rate fell to 3.6%.

Residential properties accounted for 36.2% of the total listings in Q4, remaining consistent with Q3 levels. Retail shop listings, however, saw a sharp rise from 14 in Q3 to 36 in Q4, while office listings increased from 2 to 6.

Industrial properties also experienced a growth in listings, rising from 23 in Q3 to 31 in Q4. Five shophouses were listed, making up 3.9% of the total listings.

Two notable transactions occurred in Q4. A walk-up apartment on Dickson Road, listed as a trustee sale, was sold for $1.3m, 18.2% above its opening price of $1.1m. Meanwhile, a two-bedroom apartment at Bayshore Park, listed as an owner sale, was sold at its opening price of $1.02m.

Looking ahead to 2025, the auction market is expected to face further adjustments. Rising financial distress is evident, with 4,521 bankruptcy applications filed between January and November 2024, already exceeding the 3,986 applications recorded in all of 2023.

The average annual auction success rate over the past decade has been 5.1%, and Knight Frank forecasts a similar rate of around 5% for 2025.

data.title: H1 2025 sees strong business confidence in most sectors: report
data.description:
Meanwhile, the F&B and the transportation and storage sectors are less optimistic.

The information and communication industry expresses positive sentiments for the period from January to June at +16%, according to SingStat.

SingStat reported that information services firms are optimistic, citing strong demand for data and cloud services.

Similarly, the finance and insurance industry (+14%) expects business conditions to improve. SingStat stated that banks anticipate an increase in investment activities and loan demand due to potentially lower interest rates.

In addition, the administrative and support services industry (+10%) remains optimistic about its business outlook at. Firms offering cleaning and landscape maintenance services anticipate a rise in demand, whilst employment and recruitment agencies foresee an uptick in demand for their services.

On the flip side, food and beverage (F&B) operators (-16%) are less optimistic about business prospects compared to the July to December 2024 period, which coincided with year-end holidays and the festive season.

The transportation and storage industry (-8%) also expects more challenging business conditions over the next six months. Water transport firms remain cautious about the global economic outlook and anticipate lower market demand for their services.

data.title: Daily Markets Briefing: STI down 0.7%; Top stock is Wilmar Intl
data.description:
Wilmar Intl is the top stock with a 1.28% increase.

The Straits Times Index (STI) closed at 3,828.750 down 0.7% on Monday, 2 February, at 5:21 p.m.

Wilmar Intl is the most active stock, followed by SIA (+0.94%) and ThaiBev (+0.94%).

SGX and Venture were at the foot.

data.title: SATS’ WFS expands with Menzies World Cargo acquisition in Netherlands
data.description:
The acquisition will expand WFS’ warehouse capacity to more than 50,000 sq m at Amsterdam’s Schiphol Airport.

SATS’ Worldwide Flight Services (WFS) completed the acquisition of Menzies World Cargo on 31 January.

Menzies World Cargo is part of Menzies Aviation’s General Cargo Handling Operations at Amsterdam’s Schiphol Airport (AMS).

The acquisition will increase WFS’ warehouse capacity to more than 50,000 square metres at AMS where WFS now serves over 120 airline and freight forwarder customers. 

“The Menzies World Cargo employees joining us as part of this acquisition are a welcome addition to our team and will help us ensure WFS continues to play a key role in the growth of Amsterdam’s Schiphol Airport as one of Europe’s premier air cargo gateways,” John Batten, CEO of Europe, Middle East, Africa, and Asia (EMEAA) at WFS said.

data.title: SATS Thailand secures full ownership of SFST with final 15% stake buy
data.description:
The remaining 15% stake was acquired for $3.4m.

SATS Thailand has completed the full acquisition of SATS Food Solutions Thailand (SFST) by acquiring the remaining 15% stake from Bangkok Ranch.

SATS Thailand bought the remaining stake for $3.4m (THB 85.5m), following its initial 85% investment in June 2021.

SFST is currently developing a facility in Pathum Thani, which will span approximately 35,000 square metres across three main buildings, to be completed by Q4 2024. Upon completion, the facility will increase SFST’s production capacity to 108,000 meals per day.

The acquisition will also strengthen SATS and Mitsui’s partnership with Mitsui’s planned 15% stake in SFST, combining SATS’ production with Mitsui’s distribution to drive growth.

“This milestone with SFST gives us the agility to fully capitalise on our expanded operational scale and drive our partnership with Mitsui. Our strengthened position in Thailand’s food ecosystem will enhance our ability to capture growing demand across Asia’s food services market,” Stanley Goh, CEO of Food Solutions at SATS said.

data.title: CapitaLand Ascott Trust acquires Tokyo and Kanazawa hotels for $178.5m
data.description:
The acquisition price represents an 8.3% discount on the independent valuation.

CapitaLand Ascott Trust has acquired two hotels in Japan for $178.5m (JPY21b).

The two hotels are ibis Styles Tokyo Ginza and Chisun Budget Kanazawa Ekimae in Kanazawa.

The acquisition price represents an 8.3% discount on the independent valuation.

ibis Styles Tokyo Ginza is a 224-unit hotel located next to Ginza Six, a popular high-end retail mall, and near the Uniqlo global flagship store. It is also easily accessible via Higashi Ginza or Ginza Station on Tokyo’s subway network.

Chisun Budget Kanazawa Ekima is a 392-unit hotel near the city’s central business district as well as event and sports venues. It is also within a five-minute walk to the Kanazawa train station and has flight connections with Seoul, Shanghai, and Taiwan.

“Post-acquisition, 18% of CLAS’ total assets are located in the country. With Japan continuing to enjoy strong international travel demand, the two well-located properties are poised to capture demand from travellers visiting Tokyo and Kanazawa. Visitors staying in Tokyo and Kanazawa have already surpassed pre-COVID levels by 23% and 12%, respectively,” Serena Teo, CEO of CapitaLand Ascott Trust Management and the Managers of CLAS said.
